title: Allow streaming some structs from stdin into db
Add support to track module stealth in metadata
body:
This allows adding:
```
-- Stealth: <value>
```
to the modules metadata to document how noisy the module is.

Valid values:
- `passive`: No traffic is sent directly to the target. This includes http requests, but also dns traffic and syn packets. Running a passive module should be undetectable by the target. I'm not sure if social media modules (`-- Source: accounts`) should be considered passive.
- `offline`: The network is not used at all. Definitely undetectable by the target. A module like this would probably request, process and update data that was added by other modules.
- `loud`: The module is very aggressive and likely to cause alerts. This may involve bruteforcing directories with http requests or subdomains, or anything that may cause emails to be sent (for example password resets).
- `normal`: The default if nothing is specified. You'd only use this for something like `pkg list --stealth normal`.

This still needs proper documentation for readthedocs.

It should also be possible to do:
```
sn0int --stealth passive
```
which would prevent running any modules that aren't `offline` or `passive`. A user would need to overwrite this with `run --stealth normal`.

Related to #170.

title: Fix early exit on notification and make ratelimiter more global
Make sn0int more forgiving with accidential ^C
Add basic notification system
body: Introduce a basic notification system and allow setting rules for automatic notifications on `db_activity`.

title: Implement calendar function
body: This is an interface for data written with `db_activity`.

title: Add install details for Fedora/RH based systems
body: Added notes from my install onto Fedora (23).  This is not a fresh distro install and so there is some assumption that I've needed to install `@development-tools` & `publicsuffix-list`.

title: Add select --count
body: Also improve error messages in some cases and resolve a dns resolution problem discovered on osx 10.13.

title: Use new github oauth endpoint
body: The old one is being phased out

title: Properly support inserting urls with no body
seccomp: whitelist ppoll instead of poll on aarch64
Return true if uniq activity event is already known
body: This is important so we can tell when we can stop paginating when importing activity history.

title: Add two string functions, fix seccomp issue
body: Resolves a seccomp issue related to sockets with timeouts. Also adds two functions that operate on plain strings instead of lua patterns.

title: Split codebase into sn0int and sn0int-std
body:
This is trying to split up the codebase to:

- reduce the compile time during development
- have stronger boundaries between the script runtime and the commandline tool built around it

The lua code should eventually move into sn0int-std but is currently too tightly coupled with everything else.

title: Add geo_polygon_contains
body: This adds basic geofencing support.

title: Migrate to new workspace format
body:
This migrates from:
```
~/.local/share/sn0int/foo.db
~/.local/share/sn0int/blobs/foo/
```
to
```
~/.local/share/sn0int/data/foo/db.sqlite
~/.local/share/sn0int/data/foo/blobs/
```
There's some code included to transparently do the migration when a workspace is activated. This code is going to be removed after the next few releases, all workspaces that haven't been migrated until then need to be migrated manually.

title: Misc corrections
body:
- Improve sqlite write speed with `PRAGMA synchronous = NORMAL`
- Add the `ipaddr` to the http_send response (nil in some cases)

title: Add websocket support
body: Also includes support for socket timeouts.

title: Add tab completion to sn0int repl
Add support for activity events
body:
This is still work in progress, it's starting to add the right interfaces to allow scripts to log activity as events at a specific point in time.

An event consists of a `topic`, the `time` and an arbitrary object as `content`. There are also optional fields like `uniq` that is used for de-duplication when processing non-realtime activity, and a `latitude`+`longitude` that the event can be tied to.

title: Make geoip optional due to CCPA fallout
body: This removes the hard dependency on geoip and also removes the defunct code to automatically download the geoip database.

title: Add ratelimit_throttle
body: Resolves #143

title: Use readline for prompts
body: This allows editing text input instead of just reading plain bytes. This also allows aborting prompts with ^C without exiting the whole process.

title: Misc fixes
body:
- change the balance and received fields in cryptoaddrs to BigInt
- update dependencies
- resolve a namespace conflict with certain configs

title: Support module redirects
body: This allows us to migrate users of one module to another one.

title: Support cryptocurrency addresses
body: Resolves #28

title: Update scripting documentation
body: Also introduces kpcyrd/sn0int-modules, to eat my own dogfeed and for other reasons™.

title: Add steam module and misc fixes
body:
- bump dependencies
- fix a warning that slipped through
- fix a bug in the accounts model related to profile pictures
- add a steam module

title: Allow modules to set a proxy
Solve pgp issues
body: This resolves a parsing issue with certain pgp keys and correctly handles this case in the pgp-keyserver script.

title: Add basic lua repl
body:
This is supposed to aid script development.

Unfortunately, due to restrictions in the lua library, if we want to print the result of a function we have to prefix it with `return`, so this returns nothing:
```
> sn0int_version()
>
```
While this does:
```
> return sn0int_version()
"0.13.0"
> 
```
For convenience, if tab is pressed while the cursor is at the start of the line we insert `return `, so the following combo can be used to rerun the last command with `return ` prefixed:
```
<up><ctrl a><tab><enter>
```

title: Bugfixes
body:
- Resolve a deprecation warning related to dynamic dispatch
- Increases error verbosity for non-fatal errors in some places
- Reduces the number of dns lookups for InstallTask and UpdateTask
- Bump dependencies
